item.title: Top News Matrimony.com Approves Share Buyback at ₹655 Per Share Through Tender Offer 38 minutes ago Matrimony.com has approved a share buyback program through a tender offer mechanism, setting the repurchase price at ₹655.00 per share. Shareholders can voluntarily participate in the program, offering them an opportunity to sell their holdings back to the company at the predetermined price. The tender offer structure allows eligible shareholders to decide whether to retain their shares or participate in the buyback.
item.description: Top News Matrimony.com Approves Share Buyback at ₹655 Per Share Through Tender Offer 38 minutes ago Matrimony.com has approved a share buyback program through a tender offer mechanism, setting the repurchase price at ₹655.00 per share. Shareholders can voluntarily participate in the program, offering them an opportunity to sell their holdings back to the company at the predetermined price. The tender offer structure allows eligible shareholders to decide whether to retain their shares or participate in the buyback.

item.title: Max India's AGEasy Launches Senior-Specific Gut Care Range 22 minutes ago Antara Assisted Care Services, a subsidiary of Max India Limited, has introduced AGEasy's Gut Care Range, developed in partnership with Wellbeing Nutrition. The product line addresses digestive health issues specific to India's aging population. The range includes four formulations: GutBalance, ConstiCalm, BloatCalm, and AcidityCalm, all designed to meet seniors' unique physiological needs. The products are FSSAI-certified, plant-based, and free from common allergens. This launch aims to fill a gap in the Indian healthcare market, where 4 in 10 urban seniors experience persistent digestive issues.
item.description: Max India's AGEasy Launches Senior-Specific Gut Care Range 22 minutes ago Antara Assisted Care Services, a subsidiary of Max India Limited, has introduced AGEasy's Gut Care Range, developed in partnership with Wellbeing Nutrition. The product line addresses digestive health issues specific to India's aging population. The range includes four formulations: GutBalance, ConstiCalm, BloatCalm, and AcidityCalm, all designed to meet seniors' unique physiological needs. The products are FSSAI-certified, plant-based, and free from common allergens. This launch aims to fill a gap in the Indian healthcare market, where 4 in 10 urban seniors experience persistent digestive issues.

item.title: Pre-Market Setup: Global Cues and Key Factors Shaping Today's Session 3 hours ago GIFT Nifty up 0.18% at 26,058, hinting at a positive start. US markets closed lower, with NASDAQ down 1.69%. Asian markets mixed. Commodities show strength with gold up 0.64% and crude oil rising 0.63%. USD/INR stable at 90.54. FIIs net sellers, DIIs net buyers. Notable block deals in Usha Martin Ltd, with Peterhouse Investments reducing stake.
item.description: Pre-Market Setup: Global Cues and Key Factors Shaping Today's Session 3 hours ago GIFT Nifty up 0.18% at 26,058, hinting at a positive start. US markets closed lower, with NASDAQ down 1.69%. Asian markets mixed. Commodities show strength with gold up 0.64% and crude oil rising 0.63%. USD/INR stable at 90.54. FIIs net sellers, DIIs net buyers. Notable block deals in Usha Martin Ltd, with Peterhouse Investments reducing stake.

item.title: Ashiana Ispat Reports Q1 FY26 Loss Despite Revenue Growth of ₹8,721 Crores 1 day ago Ashiana Ispat Limited posted a net loss of ₹35.33 crores for Q1 FY26 despite generating revenue of ₹8,721.44 crores through its new asset-light business model. The company faces auditor qualifications regarding statutory dues and going concern issues, multiple legal proceedings including NCLT petitions and trademark disputes, while successfully settling ₹4,310 lakhs with SBI.
item.description: Ashiana Ispat Reports Q1 FY26 Loss Despite Revenue Growth of ₹8,721 Crores 1 day ago Ashiana Ispat Limited posted a net loss of ₹35.33 crores for Q1 FY26 despite generating revenue of ₹8,721.44 crores through its new asset-light business model. The company faces auditor qualifications regarding statutory dues and going concern issues, multiple legal proceedings including NCLT petitions and trademark disputes, while successfully settling ₹4,310 lakhs with SBI.
